intro: Ligusticopsis longicalycia, commonly known as the long calyx ligusticopsis, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescence. This perennial herb typically grows in moist, temperate climates and is native to parts of Asia. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a distinctive, often spicy scent when crushed. The plant produces small white to yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters, which attract various pollinators. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
